info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 01 at 6:59AM EDT until April 01 at 7:45AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... East central Madison County in western North Carolina... Central Mitchell County in western North Carolina... Yancey County in western North Carolina... * Until 745 AM EDT. * At 658 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 11 miles northeast of Marshall, or 4 miles north of Mars Hill, moving east at 70 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Burnsville, Mars Hill, Bakersville, Bandana, Ramseytown, Green Mountain, Swiss, Faust, Wolf Ridge and Micaville. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
